biweekly.util

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.util.StringUtils

  • public final class StringUtils
extends Object
    Helper class for dealing with strings.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt

      static interface  StringUtils.JoinCallback<T>
      Callback interface used with various StringUtils.join() methods.

    • Field Detail

      • NEWLINE

        public static final String NEWLINE
        The local computer's newline character sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • afterPrefixIgnoreCase

        public static String afterPrefixIgnoreCase(String string,
                                           String prefix)

        Returns a substring of the given string that comes after the given prefix. Prefix matching is case-insensitive.

        Example: 

         String result = StringUtils.afterPrefixIgnoreCase("MAILTO:email@example.com", "mailto:");
 assertEquals("email@example.com", result);
 
 result = StringUtils.afterPrefixIgnoreCase("http://www.google.com", "mailto:");
 assertNull(result);
        Parameters:
        string - the string
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        the string or null if the prefix was not found

      • repeat

        public static void repeat(char c,
                          int count,
                          StringBuilder sb)
        Creates a string consisting of "count" occurrences of char "c".
        Parameters:
        c - the character to repeat
        count - the number of times to repeat the character
        sb - the character sequence to append the characters to

      • startsWithIgnoreCase

        public static boolean startsWithIgnoreCase(String str,
                                           String prefix)
        Like String.startsWith(java.lang.String, int), but using case-insensitive comparison.
        Parameters:
        str - the string
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the string begins with the given prefix using case-insensitive comparison, false if not

      • join

        public static <T> String join(Collection<T> collection,
                              String delimiter)
        Joins a collection of values into a delimited list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value class
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of values
        delimiter - the delimiter (e.g. ",")
        Returns:
        the final string

                            String delimiter,
                            StringBuilder sb)
        Joins a collection of values into a delimited list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value class
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of values
        delimiter - the delimiter (e.g. ",")
        sb - the string builder to append onto

      • join

        public static <T> String join(Collection<T> collection,
                              String delimiter,
                              StringUtils.JoinCallback<T> join)
        Joins a collection of values into a delimited list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value class
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of values
        delimiter - the delimiter (e.g. ",")
        join - callback function to call on every element in the collection
        Returns:
        the final string

      • join

        public static <T> void join(Collection<T> collection,
                            String delimiter,
                            StringBuilder sb,
                            StringUtils.JoinCallback<T> join)
        Joins a collection of values into a delimited list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value class
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of values
        delimiter - the delimiter (e.g. ",")
        sb - the string builder to append onto
        join - callback function to call on every element in the collection
